title: Elon Musk’s response to an anti-trans video sparked 24 hours of chaos at Twitter
description: Twitter was roiled by an organized pressure campaign by conservative pundits seeking to promote a 95-minute anti-transgender video called “What Is A Woman?”

title: Churchill Downs, home of Kentucky Derby, suspends racing after 12 horses die
description: Churchill Downs announced it is suspending all racing as safety measures are re-examined following the deaths of a dozen horses at the famed track in the past month.

title: Who receives food benefits? It may not be who you think
description: Work-requirement proponents say the problem is unemployment, but nearly 4 out of 5 of households in the SNAP program have at least one person working.

title: YouTube will stop removing false claims about 2020 election fraud
description: Google-owned YouTube will stop removing false claims of widespread election fraud in the 2020 presidential race, the video platform announced on Friday.

title: At least 179 people reported injured after passenger train derails in India
description: NEW DELHI — A passenger train derailed in eastern India, trapping many people inside its derailed coaches, officials said.

title: Arkansas librarians sue to block new law that could jail them over explicit books
description: Public libraries and book publishers in Arkansas are suing to block Act 372, a law that makes it easier to send librarians to jail over books children read.

title: Pride Night celebrations at the ballpark were largely uncontroversial — until now
description: Pride Night celebrations in professional sports went off with a minimum of fanfare, as clubs eagerly showed off their embrace of the LGBTQ community.

title: CIA Director Bill Burns took a secret trip to China in May
description: CIA Director William Burns took his first trip to China in May after tensions over the downing of a Chinese spy balloon prompted Beijing to halt regular calls.

title: Biden to deliver Oval Office speech about bipartisan debt ceiling deal
description: Watch President Biden address the nation at 7 p.m. ET from the Oval Office after Congress voted to cut spending and extend the debt ceiling for two years.

title: DOJ closes Pence classified documents investigation with no charges
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence will not be charged in the discovery of classified documents at his Indiana home, according to a letter obtained by NBC News.

title: Texas cheerleader shot 3 times after friend got into wrong car recalls harrowing attack and hurdles in recovery
description: Payton Washington, the Texas cheerleader who was shot and critically injured after a friend accidentally got into the wrong car in April, says she didn’t even see the shooter and tried to keep her friends calm, even as she was bleeding.

title: Twitter trust and safety chief Ella Irwin resigns
description: Twitter’s head of trust and safety Ella Irwin resigned from her role at the Elon Musk-owned social media platform.

title: The U.S. economy added 339,000 jobs in May, once again beating expectations
description: The U.S. economy continued to crank out jobs in May, with nonfarm payrolls surging more than expected despite multiple headwinds, the Labor Department reported Friday.

title: US Ambassador confronts antisemitism during visit to Germany
description: Amy Gutman, the U.S. ambassador to Germany, made an emotional homecoming to the German town her father’s family fled after Hitler’s rise to power. Reporting for TODAY, NBC’s Andrea Mitchell travels with Gutman as she confronts the growing threat of antisemitism.

title: 8-year-old who died in Border Patrol custody was not sent to hospital despite 104.9-degree fever
description: Border Patrol medical workers declined to review documents and refused repeated requests for an ambulance in the hours before 8-year-old Anadith Tanay Reyes Álvarez died.

title: Number of migrants crossing the southern border hits lowest point since Biden took office
description: The number of migrants crossing the border has hit its lowest point since Joe Biden took office. Here are four reasons why there was no post Title 42 surge.

title: Porn stars vs. parenthood: Ron DeSantis plays the family card against Trump
description: Ron DeSantis is leaning into an image that projects wholesome family values in an attempt to win over Iowa evangelicals who may be turned off by Trump's drama.

title: Senate passes debt ceiling bill, sending it to Biden to become law and avert disaster
description: The Senate voted Thursday to pass a Biden-McCarthy bill to extend the debt ceiling for two years and avoid economic disaster on a broad bipartisan vote.

title: Attorney accused of rapes in Boston in 2007 and 2008 faces charges
description: An attorney accused in a series of sexual assaults in Boston more than a decade ago waived extradition in New Jersey on Thursday and was set to return to Massachusetts, officials said.
